commitResults.messageTitle: Revert "Demo data does not include new attributes of Person"

commitResults.messageBody:
Currently the `delete` command uses index to delete a person.

Due to the use of index, `list` is utilized to get the correct index first.
This results in an additional command being used making it slow to type out both commands.

With this modification, Hustlebook deletes a person using their name. This can be achieved with only one command now.
Removes un-utilized import statements and use of constant variable.
Re-order the import statements.

Currently the `edit` command requests users for index to select and edit a person.

Due to the use of index, `list` is utilized to get the correct index first.
This results in the user doing two commands to fulfil one., making it time consuming.

With this modification, HustleBook edits a person using their name.
Updates the user guide summary to reflect the correct usage of the command.
Updates the build gradle file to create the jar file with the correct name.
Updates user guide to give users more information regarding the commands

Currently, the main java folder (tp/src/main) still has reference to "AddressBook". This might cause confusion as the application name is "HustleBook".

This update changes to all occurrences of  "AddressBook" to "HustleBook" to match with the application name.

Renames the class to match the application name.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update UI to have text display of salary
commitResults.messageBody: This update enables the salary to be displayed for each client.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update Add command, Edit command and Test
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, the salary attribute has been implemented but users cannot add this attribute to their contacts as well as edit this in their contacts.

This update allows the users to add and edit salary attribute for their clients.
Additionally, the test is updated to reflect these changes.

Currently, the salary attribute is combined with the other attributes when being displayed. This results in the clients information section to be clustered.

This update modified the GUI to display the salary attribute as a Flowpane with green background, making it easier to identify the salary attribute.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update GUI display of last date met and upcoming meeting attribute
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, the last date met and the upcoming meeting attribute is displayed together with other attributes. This results in long and messy organization of client information.

This update modified the GUI to display the last date met attribute and upcoming meeting attribute separately from the other attributes.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update user guide link in the help
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, the user guide link directs users to the old AB3 user guide webpage.

This update modified the link to the direct users to the Hustlebook user guide webpage.

Currently, when adding clients with no salary attribute, HustleBook throws an error.

This update fixed that bug and sets a default value to salary when no salary attribute is provided.
Usage information of the undo command is added.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix bug with delay in flag and unflag command
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, the flag and unflag commands are not reflected immediately in the GUI.

This update fixes this issue.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix bug with delay in scheduledMeeting
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, changes to scheduledMeeting attribute through the meet command is not immediately reflected in the GUI.

This update fixes this issue.
Update the incorrect documentation of the error message to reflect the correct and intended behavior.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix usage of flag using add command

commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, the redo command misbehaves when information is updated after an undo and redo is requested. In this case, redo should not be working.

This update fixes this issue and ensures that redo is not possible once an information update is done.
Also added kuanjr.md and renamed jr.png to kuanjr.png

commitResults.messageBody:
Add feature to detect duplicates and let user choose which of the
duplicates they wish to delete.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix bugs related to matching names
commitResults.messageBody:
This fixes 2 bugs:
1. Scenario: There are 2 clients with names: "John" and "John Doe"
       User runs `find John Doe`
       Expected: HustleBook lists only "John Doe" as the name fully
                 matches the search term.
       Actual:   HusltBook lists both "John" and "John Doe"

2. Scenario: There are 2 clients with names: "John" and "John Doe"
    User wants to Edit "John Doe"
    Expected: HustleBook edits "John Doe" straight away, without asking
              the user for additional input
    Actual:   HustleBook lists "John Doe" and "John", and asks user for
              additional input

    The same bug occurs for the `Delete` command

This commit fixes both these bugs such that HustleBook's behaviour
matches the expected outcomes

commitResults.messageTitle: Person object does not contain needed attributes for a client.
commitResults.messageBody:
Client requires an attribute to capture essential information
and last met up date.

Let's,
* add Info class and PrevDateMet class

* modified add command feature to accept the new syntax prefixes
* modified test files to fit with the new attributes

Users of HustleBook can now add in info using i/ in CLI and
add previous date met using d/ with "YYYY-MM-DD" format.

Note:
* Test cases for both classes not implemented
* Require discussion regarding PrevDateMet (to save as
String or LocalDate)
* Require discussion regarding i/ and d/ if it is an optional input

commitResults.messageTitle: Add command message usage and example is not updated with the new prefix of flag, info and previous date met
commitResults.messageBody:
User would need to know the new command format if they enter the
wrong format.

Let's change the message usage to address the new command format with
example that showcases all three pre-fix that were implemented.

This should close #52.

commitResults.messageTitle: Test cases for PrevDateMet not implemented
commitResults.messageBody:
Regression testing should be implemented to avoid future bugs when
implementing other features.
A bug found in ParserUtil needs to be squished ASAP.

Let's,
* implement the correct regular expression for PrevDateMet.
* add test cases for PrevDateMet using JUnit5 testing.
* fix the bug found in ParserUtil

This should close #51.

commitResults.messageTitle: Default date is set to 2022-03-14 as a temporary fix
commitResults.messageBody:
Default date of previous date met should be set to date of when
the client is being added into HustleBook. Default value of info
of an empty string can be counterintuitive when displayed in the
HustleBook.

Let's,
* change the default value of date to the current date of adding
client.
* change the default value of info to No further info.

commitResults.messageTitle: Person attribute does not have an upcoming meeting
commitResults.messageBody:
To allow users to schedule meeting with clients, person would
require to have an upcoming meeting attribute that is added by
the user.

JsonSerialiazableAddressBook does not have the correct file name.

Let's
* Add MeetingDate class to handle the date of the meeting.
* Add MeetingTime class to handle the time of the meeting.
* Add ScheduledMeeting class to capture the date and time of the
upcoming meeting.
* Add ScheduledMeeting as an attribute to the person class.
* Rename JsonSerialiazableAddressBook to JsonSerialiazableHustleBook.

Note:
Tests have yet to be done and person isEqual method yet to check on
scheduled meeting attribute.

A few lines had the wrong documentation.

Let's update to fit the correct description for documentation.

commitResults.messageTitle: Modify code to handle no upcoming meeting
commitResults.messageBody:

no upcoming meeting for a client.

when a person is being created.
* use boolean to check if scheduled meeting is non-null.

Let's update code indentation to pass checkstyle test.

commitResults.messageTitle: Command to schedule meeting is not implemented
commitResults.messageBody:
HustleBook users needs to manage meeting with their clients through
the command box.

Let's create a new command "meet" that takes in the parameters of
date and time.

Note:
* Test for meet commands not yet tested.
* Need to discuss on how to handle default value of no scheduled
meeting in Json format.
* Edit and deleting of scheduled meeting is not implemented yet.

commitResults.messageTitle: Meet command using prefix that is not intuitive
commitResults.messageBody:
Prefix currently used are md/ and mt/ to represent date and time of
the meeting. Would be more intuitive to use d/ and t/ for date and
time.

Let's
* Change the prefix of meet command.
* Modify code for edit command to handle d/ prefix to only modify
previous date met and not meeting date.
* Remove at: between date and time when saving into Json file.
* Only shows at between date and time when displaying it in the GUI.

Edit command does not change existing scheduled meetings of the person
but it cannot be ignored as it requires to get the existing
meeting to reconstruct the edited person.

Let's
* Add a comment to clarify the process behind this.
* Improve code quality when handling booleans in if statements.

commitResults.messageTitle: Unable to cancel meeting through meet command
commitResults.messageBody:
Meet command should be able to handle a way to clear
scheduled meeting with clients.
Displaying no scheduled meeting was also not working as intended.

Let's
* add a prefix c/ to clear meetings for client.
* add proper regular expression check for 24hr format time input.
* bugfix to display no scheduled meeting properly.

User Guide is not updated with the new commands `meet`, `flag`,
and `unflag`.

Let's update the User Guide with these new commands.

Meetings could be scheduled to the same date and time as existing
meetings which should not occur. Add a check whenever user schedules
a meeting that compares with the existing meetings.

Let's add a check to ensure meetings that are scheduled
does not clash with existing ones.

A temporary product page required for CS2101. Can be removed after
product demo is done.

Date check does not check for date that does not exist
such as 29 Feb when it is not a leap year.

Let's add an additional check to check the date existence when parsing
the date.

Label will truncate if GUI is too small.

Let's change how label behaves and prevent the truncate.

in the find by NAME feature to malfunction.

Let's
* add validity check for name.
* change the test cases for the new validity checks.

UG does not reflect the validity check and what is considered
duplicate clients.

Let's update UG to reflect the changes of validity check on the name
and state what is considered a duplicate.
